title: ROS interface to BDI STEP problems

content.raw:
The ROS interface to the BDI STEP behavior has at least two (possibly related) problems.  The first issue is that it doesn't place the foot at the desired location.  The second issue is that it is not possible to recover after entering the BDI STEP behavior.  Neither a command to STAND or an AtlasCommand can recover.  The only way is to re-start the simulator.  A test case is attached.

Expected behavior - left foot is placed higher as if putting the foot on a 10cm step
Actual behavior - right foot moves, BDI stuck in STEP mode, BDI STAND command and an AtlasCommand don't reset BDI module.  Message in window where Gazebo was started:
- user desired plan: 
Step 0
  duration 0.000000
  lfoot
    position 0.035572, 0.153140, 0.000008
    yaw 0.266051
    moved 0
    in_contact 1
  rfoot
    position 0.016008, -0.157999, 0.000048
    yaw -0.343160
    moved 0
    in_contact 1
(keeps repeating)

Issue is present in both drcsim 2.4 and 2.5.  Test case is for 2.5
Related discussion at:
http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/2424/drcsim-ros-interface-to-bdi-walk-and-step/
